description: This was the first time a government building had been hit in the over three-year-long war. President Volodymyr Zelensky said he was counting on a strong US response shortly after Donald Trump said he might impose more sanctions on Moscow.

headline: Alcaraz beats Sinner to win US Open and reclaim No.1 ranking
description: The 22-year-old won 6-2, 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 to capture his second US Open crown and sixth Grand Slam title, avenging his lone defeat in a major final by Sinner at Wimbledon in July.

headline: Tradition done right: Five Paris restaurants reimagining the classics
description: Are you a fan of French cuisine classics such as 'œufs en meurette' (poached eggs in red wine sauce), 'navarin d'agneau' (lamb stew) and apple tart? Discover our selection of five Paris restaurants that awaken both the appetite and a sense of nostalgia.

description: The commissioner general of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees tells Le Monde that countries have an 'extremely broad range' of options to 'stop all the atrocities being committed' in the enclave.

Isabelle Adjani's puzzling career, from disappearances to spectacular comebacks
description: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (6/6). Since the success of 'L'Eté Meurtrier' ('One Deadly Summer') in 1983, the actress has continually alternated between periods of intense activity and long breaks. If her career is hard to decipher, its diverse output attests to her genius for the trade.

headline: Did Macron really add €1 trillion to France's national debt?
description: While this figure often cited by opposition parties is misleading, France's debt has risen significantly under Emmanuel Macron's presidency, partly due to his tax policy decisions.

headline: Fashion retreats from diversity: 'We are again being openly asked for Caucasian models'
description: Until recently, the industry enthusiastically embraced the major social issues stirring society. From supporting Pride to Black Lives Matter, to championing inclusivity in the representation of bodies and identities, fashion seemed in tune with the times. But the tide has turned. The election of Donald Trump, who issued a series of anti-diversity executive orders, has changed everything.
